content:
Nice clash, but I feel like the Impossible test cases are a bit unnecessary, what kind of competitive game has a ranking system in which you can't gain or lose any points?


How did the player in the "IMPOSSIBLE" test case get to 7 ranking points if you get 0 points for winning/losing? :P

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very easy to understand the goal, fun aspect to it as well. Great job!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This problem is good man! Continue this way ^^
Ne lis pas ce com je fais ca juste pour le succès

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: As a huge video game player this problem made me laugh ^^ ! 
It's not hard at all to understand, you can do it different ways. 
Very nice and funny that's a yes for me !

- Please change <<actual>> to <<initial>>.
- Please provide an upper bound to the constaints.
- Please provide more edge testcase such as b == o. Your solution fails at
0
0
0
0
- Referring to my suggestion above, can you elaborate why b <= o? I don't see a reason why this constaints appear.
- My mathematics skill isn't that good but I'm fairly sure that losses don't count into the answer? If that's true it doesn't make any sense.

- Not important but I'm pretty sure ceiling divison does the trick instead of naive while loop.

I think you need a case where you would land exactly on the objective ranking points. I came up with the same solution as you but then I realized this solution doesn't work if you had the following input, for example:
0  5  0  100

You would need to play 20 games to reach a score of 100 but your solution (and mine) would give an answer of 21.

Other than that...
Goal:
Replace "number of game" with "number of games"

Output:
Replace "to do" with "to play"
Replace "looses" with "loses"

Constraints:
I think it would be fair to say all of these values should be greater than or equal to 0 (not just p)

I liked it though, interesting context and very quick/easy to do for a clash.

Input :
Maybe replace « rank » by points for b
Same replace « o » with the POINTS you want to get to and not the rank. A rank cant be an integer.

Output : 
Replace o with [[o]]

Constraints :
What values can p take ?
Can it goes negative ?
Thanks for your message, i updated everything
I changed the solution. Validator 1 land exactly the objective, Test 4 too. Thanks for your comment

Your objective is to get higher than your initial rank this why b <= o, your objective is not to lose point. If you lose, you lose point too so you need to count them as negative point (- losses * point). Thank you for the suggestion

ty for the changes

- Can you clarify the operation priority? For the last validator
1
1
1
1
I thought you have to minus the score first because in the output it says "counting losses"?
- Also for the games that will be lost are those counted in the answer?
i corrected it, i did a mistake

Output section
* You miss one o in the first line: please also replace it with [[o]].

* Please change "looses" to "losses".

* Please format "TOO HARD" as a {{constant}} instead of in <<bold>>.

Cases
* The first pair of test and validator are the same. Please change them so that they are similar but different.

Thanks.
